    Mediterranean Mixed Farm: Goats for meat and milk production

    MediterraneanMixedFarmMeatMilkProduction.Rmd

    Problem Statemen

    Problem Statement A Mediterranean farm has

    15 ha of arable land

    350 h of labor

    500 kg of available N fertilizer

    It may allocate land to:

    Four winter crops:

    Oat (80 kg N/ha, 20 h/ha, € 400/ha), 2 ≤ ha ≤ 8

    Barley (100 kg N/ha, 25 h/ha, € 450/ha), 1 ≤ ha ≤ 6

    Lupin ( 0 kg N/ha, 15 h/ha, € 350/ha), 3 ≤ ha ≤ 7

    Fava (30 kg N/ha, 30 h/ha, € 500/ha), 2 ≤ ha ≤ 5

    Pasture for on‐farm feed (20 kg N/ha, 10 h/ha, € 150/ha), ≤ 10 ha

    A dairy‐meat goat herd:

    Meat goats (0 kg N, 15 h/doe, € 70/doe)

    Milk goats (0 kg N, 50 h/doe, € 120/doe)

    All these activities share the same land, labor and N resources. We wish to maximize total gross margin.

    Step 1: Define Resource Constraints (flexible min/max for each crop) 

    # Step 1: Define Resources (add goats_max & kids_min)
resources <- define_resources(
  resources = c(
    # Global totals
    "land",   "labor",   "nitrogen",
    # Crop area bounds
    "oat_min","oat_max",
    "barley_min","barley_max",
    "lupin_min","lupin_max",
    "fava_min","fava_max",
    # Pasture
    "pasture_max"
  ),
  availability = c(
    # Totals
    15,  350, 500,
    # Oat bounds
     2,    8,
    # Barley bounds
     1,    6,
    # Lupin bounds
     3,    7,
    # Fava bounds
     2,    5,
    # Pasture ≤ 10 ha
    10
  ),
  direction = c(
    # Totals all ≤
    "<=", "<=", "<=",
    # mins ≥, maxes ≤
    ">=", "<=",  # oat
    ">=", "<=",  # barley
    ">=", "<=",  # lupin
    ">=", "<=",  # fava
    "<="         # pasture
  )
)

print(resources)
#>       resource availability direction
#> 1         land           15        <=
#> 2        labor          350        <=
#> 3     nitrogen          500        <=
#> 4      oat_min            2        >=
#> 5      oat_max            8        <=
#> 6   barley_min            1        >=
#> 7   barley_max            6        <=
#> 8    lupin_min            3        >=
#> 9    lupin_max            7        <=
#> 10    fava_min            2        >=
#> 11    fava_max            5        <=
#> 12 pasture_max           10        <=

    Step 2: Define Activities 

    # Step 2: Define Activities
# Rows must match resources$resource
activity_requirements_matrix <- matrix(
  c(
    # land (ha per unit)
     1,  1,  1,  1,  1,   0.05,  0.05,
    # labor (h per unit)
    20, 25, 15, 30, 10,   15,    50,
    # nitrogen (kg per unit)
    80,100,  0, 30, 20,    0,     0,
    # oat_min row (1 only under oat col)
     1,  0,  0,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # oat_max
     1,  0,  0,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # barley_min
     0,  1,  0,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # barley_max
     0,  1,  0,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # lupin_min
     0,  0,  1,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # lupin_max
     0,  0,  1,  0,  0,    0,     0,
    # fava_min
     0,  0,  0,  1,  0,    0,     0,
    # fava_max
     0,  0,  0,  1,  0,    0,     0,
    # pasture_max (only pasture col)
     0,  0,  0,  0,  1,    0,     0
  ),
  nrow = nrow(resources),
  byrow = TRUE,
  dimnames = list(
    resources$resource,
    c("oat","barley","lupin","fava","pasture","goat_meat","goat_milk")
  )
)

objective <- c(
  oat        = 400,
  barley     = 450,
  lupin      = 350,
  fava       = 500,
  pasture    = 150,
  goat_meat  =  70,
  goat_milk  = 120
)

activities <- define_activities(
  activities = colnames(activity_requirements_matrix),
  activity_requirements_matrix = activity_requirements_matrix,
  objective = objective
)

print(activities)
#>            activity land labor nitrogen oat_min oat_max barley_min barley_max
#> oat             oat 1.00    20       80       1       1          0          0
#> barley       barley 1.00    25      100       0       0          1          1
#> lupin         lupin 1.00    15        0       0       0          0          0
#> fava           fava 1.00    30       30       0       0          0          0
#> pasture     pasture 1.00    10       20       0       0          0          0
#> goat_meat goat_meat 0.05    15        0       0       0          0          0
#> goat_milk goat_milk 0.05    50        0       0       0          0          0
#>           lupin_min lupin_max fava_min fava_max pasture_max objective
#> oat               0         0        0        0           0       400
#> barley            0         0        0        0           0       450
#> lupin             1         1        0        0           0       350
#> fava              0         0        1        1           0       500
#> pasture           0         0        0        0           1       150
#> goat_meat         0         0        0        0           0        70
#> goat_milk         0         0        0        0           0       120

    Step 3: Build and Solve the Model 

    # Step 3: Build and Solve the Model
model <- create_ram_model(resources, activities)
solution <- solve_ram(model, direction = "max")

    Step 4: Results 

    dat <- data.frame(
  activity = names(solution$optimal_activities),
  level    = round(as.numeric(solution$optimal_activities), 1)
)

DT::datatable(
  dat,
  rownames = FALSE,
  options = list(
    autoWidth = TRUE,
    columnDefs = list(
      list(width = '2cm', targets = 0),  # first column (activity)
      list(width = '2cm', targets = 1)   # second column (level)
    )
  )
) |>
  DT::formatRound(
    columns = "level",
    digits  = 2
  )
    cat("Maximum gross margin (EUR):", solution$objective_value, "\n")
#> Maximum gross margin (EUR): 6367.368
    plot_ram(solution)
